H0.text: during the great depression in the 1930s the u.s. economy experienced a. Downturn

H1.text: during the great depression in the 1930s the u.s. economy experienced a. Stagnation

H2.text: during the great depression in the 1930s the u.s. economy experienced a. Contraction

H3.text: during the great depression in the 1930s the u.s. economy experienced a. recession

A4.text: the U.S. did not return to 1929 GNP for over a decade and still had an unemployment rate of about 15% in 1940

A5.text: the recession of 1937â€“1938, which slowed down economic recovery from the Great Depression, is explained by fears of the population that the moderate tightening of the monetary and fiscal policy in 1937 were first steps to a restoration of the pre-1933 policy regime

A6.text: the suspension of competition policy in the United States in the 1930s may have extended the Great Depression
